text: Dawn Hayley Foster (12 September 1987 â€“ July 2021) was a British journalist, broadcaster, and author. She was a staff writer for Jacobin magazine. She also worked for The Independent, The Nation, The Guardian and Dissent. Foster suffered from epilepsy and schwannomatosis. Foster died in July 2021 from a long-illness in London, aged 34. ==References== Category:1987 births Category:2021 deaths Category:British journalists Category:Writers from Belfast
title: Dawn Foster
